Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Just a thought but considering Komodo has the same wallet addresses as AC, it might be a good idea to build an explorer that shows you full balances of all coins in an address. like when you look up an ETH address and it tells you the tokens that are stored in that address as well. This might also be a good feature for starting up Agama or BarterDEX (Start up by auto loading all coins with a balance). I think in the future we could see more AC startups and performing Airdrops, and its possible people don't realize they have these coins from the airdrops because they never heard of it, or just weren't paying attention, so they wouldn't activate the wallet. 

I also understand that technically all these addresses would be using different blockchains which adds more complexity to it, but I'm not sure on how much more complex this would be to view AC addresses too.

Content: Oh awesome!

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
I'm trying to create an asset chain with 100% premined coins. People that mine blocks for this asset chain will get tx fees, but no mining reward.

It was easy to create a new asset chain using the following configuration:

`./komodod -pubkey=<pubkey> -ac_name=<myCoin> -ac_supply=100000000 -ac_reward=0 -ac_end=0 -addnode=<ipOfNode>  &`

But there's still one problem I cannot solve: With this configuration miners still get `0.00010000` mining reward, and the total amount of coins is growing. 

Q: How can I make an asset chain in which the total amount of coins does not increase over time / what am I missing here?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: I believe 0.00010000  is the minimum it has to generate to make a block. If you don't want your supply to increase just send the extra generated coins to the burnadress

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: example: BEER was premined with 100m and how has 99'996'985 supply which indicated that 3015 BEER was burned

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: How would this work? Everyone can be a miner. So every miner gets 0.00010000 for every mined block. How can I configure that extra generated coins go to the burn address automatically?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: you as the dev of your chain keep a supply of x coins setup a cronjob thatsends the extra coins to the burnaddress

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: Or is this a manual process, by the project team that created the coin?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: yes 'manual'

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: that's the only way I think of you can control the supply maybe thereis a possibility to generate 0 block rewards blocks

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
Ok üòÉ Thank you very much for this. Is this the same configuration as the DEX coin has?

edit: Ah, I can see that is the case in `~/komodo/src/assetchains.old
`. So manual burns are common here as well.

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: DEX was issued with 1m coins and now has now 1'000'030    so 30 DEX where mined from on demand blocks

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: Nice. Then this will be the configuration for my coin: `./komodod -pubkey=<pubkey> -ac_name=<myCoin> -ac_supply=100000000 -addnode=<ipOfNode>  &`

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: yes thats sounds like a standard chain like DEX SN etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the problem is ac_reward was 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: set ac_reward to non-0, otherwise it uses the default 0.0001 reward

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and set the -ac_end to be 1

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: @bartwr ^ here is your solution

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
I set `-ac_end=1` and removed `-ac_reward=x`. This works: No default mining fee is given for miners that mine blocks. Perfect, thank you @jl777c @CHMEX . My final coin setup is:

`./komodod -pubkey=<pubKey> -ac_name=<coinName> -ac_supply=100000000 -ac_end=1 -addnode=<IP> &`

Works well!

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: https://blog.nucypher.com/releasing-nufhe-library-b5f9345dc1fb

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: interesting development about full homomorphic encryption

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: too high level for me, but I found this part interesting:

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: "The difficulty is that smart contract privacy isn‚Äôt compatible with having one global shared state for all contracts and users like in Ethereum. Each user is only able to decrypt what is encrypted for them and FHE doesn‚Äôt support working with random access memory‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääone needs to pass all the state through a circuit. Thus, a practical implementation requires more diligent thinking than merely continuing to accelerate FHE (which we plan to continue doing)"

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: it sounds as if Kmd, with contracts in their own smartchains, is a better match

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: One thing i had to do in the hush-ng codebase was try to make the RPC connection a singleton, only have 1 around at a time. It's easy to accidentally create multiple rpc objects that keep open multiple RPC connections and slows everything down

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: currently most stratums use the blocktemplate to gather minimal data and "fake" the new cb tx from the ground up. I want to, instead, get the template and just substitute the proper info.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: seems reasonable

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: remember, as James reminded me recently, RPC operations are single-threaded, so having more than 1 RPC connection open per application is a big waste

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: yeah, that's why I wanted to use a lib, that way less calls
